resources.string: To prevent possible damage to this phones LED circuit, you can set a Maximum Possible Brightness Limit. \n \nNote: If your default brightness setting is higher than the limit, your default brightness setting will be reduced to the limit.
Default Brightness is the Torch brightness when pressing the on button or tapping the 1x1 widget if Double/Rapid tap is off.
This value is the number of levels the notification and widgets increment the Torch brightness by.
Use the slider below to set quick increment value.\nCurrent value: %s
Quick Increment cannot be greater than Default Brightness

This affects the 1x1 Widget 

With DoubleTap enabled: 
Your first tap will turn the Torch on at brightness level 1. 
The second tap will light the torch to your default brightness setting.

This affects the 1x1 Widget 

With RapidTap enabled: 
Rapidly tapping thie widget will increment the Torch by the Quick increment setting each tap.

This effects Double/Rapid Tap: 

 The time window in milliseconds between taps that will increase the brightness. 
If you tap after this time, the Torch will shut off.
Enter the maximum time allowed to Rapid tap or Double tap the 1x1 widget. \n Current value: %s ms
Enable Keeping the Torch in Andriods Notification drop down.
Enable the Ability To Hide the Torch Notification when Persistent Notification is enabled.
Press Back Button To Apply Settings
